Mobile Application Engineer Job at Source Microfinance Bank




        
    

        
        Source Microfinance Bank is a digital bank with a focus on how to serve you better always! At Source Credit, we have our plans to serve you better right at the center of all we do, and our service offerings. We also ensure we give the best customer service experience that is tailored just for you. Source Microfinance Bank is poised to change the face of banking in Nigeria. We are reinventing banking to empower a generation.

We are recruiting to fill the position below

Job Position: Mobile Application Engineer

Job Location: Lagos

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Design and build native iOS and Android applications using React Native. 
	Write clean, reusable, and maintainable React Native code. 
	Implement complex UI components and animations. 
	Integrate with various APIs and backend services.
	Implement unit and integration tests for code coverage and quality assurance.
	Optimize app performance for both iOS and Android devices.
	Collaborate with designers, product managers, and other engineers to bring produt vision to life.
	Stay up to date with the latest React Native trends and technologies. 


Requirements


	2+ years of experience developing mobile applications with React Native. 
	Strong understanding of React, JavaScript, and object-oriented programming principles.
	Experience with iOS development (Swift or Objective-C) and/or Android development (Kotlin or Java) is a plus.
	Experience with Redux, MobX, or other state management libraries (a plus).

Senior NET Full Stack Developer Job at ResumeSurge




        
    

        
        ResumeSurge - We connect ambitious businesses with exceptional talent. We are a forward-thinking recruitment consultancy dedicated to helping companies find the right people to drive their success and helping skilled professionals find the right opportunities to advance their careers.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior NET Full Stack Developer

Job Location: Gbagada, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a highly experienced Senior, NET Full Stack Developer who excels across the Microsoft technology stack.
	The ideal candidate combines deep technical expertise with a solution-oriented mindset, capable of analyzing business challenges, proposing practical technical approaches, and delivering robust solutions with minimal supervision.
	Working Structure: This is a hybrid role (2 days onsite, 3 days remote), but the first two months will be fully on-site at our premises in Gbagada, Lagos. The position requires a standard 40-hour work week, with 8 hours per day.


ResponsibilitIes


	Design, develop, and maintain scalable web applications using ASP.NET, MVC, C#, .NET Core, and Entity Framework.
	Work confidently with Microsoft SQL Server (MSSQL), including complex queries, stored procedures, and performance optimization.
	Develop and integrate front-end components using Razor, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3.
	Collaborate with business and technical stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into well-structured, maintainable code.
	Provide multiple technical solution options to address business needs, evaluate trade- offs, and lead the chosen implementation.
	Ensure adherence to best practices in coding, testing, and deployment.
	Apply unit testing practices to ensure code reliability and maintainability.
	Leverage AI tools and techniques to enhance productivity and code quality where applicable.
	Troubleshoot and resolve complex application and performance issues.
	Mentor junior developers and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives.


Requirements


	6+ years of professional experience in software development using the Microsoft stack.
	Strong command of C#, ASP.NET MVC/Core, Entity Framework, and MSSQL.
	Experience with Web API, RESTful services, and integrations with third-party systems.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to propose and evaluate multiple technical solutions.
	Excellent communication skills and the ability to work independently with minimal direction.
	Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automated deployment processes.
	Some exposure to using AI-assisted development tools to improve efficiency.


Preferred qualities:


	Pragmatic thinker who focuses on delivering results.
	Self-motivated, dependable, and capable of owning projects end-to-end.
	Collaborative, but confident enough to make technical decisions when needed.


Salary
N1,200,000 - N1,500,000 Monthly.

title: Job Openings at Amaiden Energy Nigeria Limited
content:
Amaiden Energy Nigeria Limited (formerly Moody International Nigeria Limited) was established in 1996 as a partnership between Moody International Group and Nigerian investors. Since commencing operations in March 1997 the company continues to grow and exerts its presence in numerous Projects in the Nigeria Oil and Gas Industry.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Condition Monitoring Officer – RA Public Areas

Job Location: Bonny Island, Port Harcourt, Rivers
Job Nature: Standard

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Condition Monitoring Officer is responsible for monitoring, inspecting, and assessing the condition of rotating and static equipment, facilities, and public area assets within the RA (Residential Area) to ensure safety, reliability, and optimal performance.
	The role supports preventive and predictive maintenance programs through data collection, analysis, and reporting on asset health.


Key Responsibilities


	Conduct routine inspections and monitoring of equipment and public area utilities (e.g., pumps, HVAC systems, lighting, water systems, and generators).
	Collect and analyze data using vibration analysis, thermography, oil analysis, and other condition monitoring tools.
	Identify potential equipment failures and recommend corrective actions to prevent downtime.
	Maintain accurate records of asset condition, inspection results, and maintenance recommendations.
	Support the implementation of preventive and predictive maintenance programs.
	Ensure compliance with safety standards, maintenance procedures, and environmental policies.
	Liaise with maintenance, operations, and HSE teams to coordinate required interventions.
	Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives to enhance asset reliability and performance


Qualifications and Experience


	B.Sc. or HND in Mechanical, Electrical, or Maintenance Engineering (or related field).
	5 years of experience in condition monitoring or maintenance within the oil and gas or energy sector.
	Knowledge of predictive maintenance tools (vibration, thermography, oil analysis, ultrasonic testing).
	Familiarity with CMMS or reliability-based maintenance systems.
	Certification in Condition Monitoring or Reliability Engineering is an added advantage.


Skills and Competencies:


	Strong diagnostic and analytical skills.
	Good understanding of mechanical and electrical systems.
	Attention to detail and commitment to asset integrity.
	Excellent communication and reporting skills.
	Ability to work independently and within multidisciplinary teams.
	Adherence to safety and environmental best practices.


Click here to apply online

 

2.) Facility Engineer

Job Location: Bonny Island, Port Harcourt, Rivers
Job Nature: Standard

Job Summary


	The Facility Engineer is responsible for overseeing the operation, maintenance, and integrity of company facilities and infrastructure to ensure safe, efficient, and reliable support for operations.
	The role includes planning, coordinating, and implementing maintenance programs, project works, and facility improvements in line with company policies and industry standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Supervise and coordinate the maintenance, repair, and operation of facilities, including buildings, utilities, HVAC systems, power supply, and related infrastructure.
	Plan and implement preventive and corrective maintenance schedules to ensure asset reliability.
	Monitor contractors’ performance and ensure compliance with technical, safety, and quality requirements.
	Support facility upgrades, refurbishments, and small capital projects from design to completion.
	Conduct regular inspections to identify maintenance needs and safety concerns.
	Prepare technical reports, work orders, and documentation on facility condition and performance.
	Collaborate with HSE, operations, and logistics teams to ensure smooth facility operations.
	Manage budgets, materials, and resources for maintenance and project activities.


Qualifications and Experience


	B.Sc. or HND in Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, or Facility Engineering.
	5–7 years of experience in facility management or engineering within the oil and gas or industrial sector.
	Sound knowledge of building systems (HVAC, power, plumbing, fire protection, etc.).
	Familiarity with maintenance management systems (e.g., CMMS) and safety regulations.
	Project management experience and understanding of construction standards are an advantage.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Mid & Long-Term Planner – CHO, ABJ & LTO

Job Location: Bonny Island, Port Harcourt, Rivers
Job Nature: Standard

Description


	The Mid- & Long-Term Planner is responsible for developing, coordinating, and optimizing medium- and long-term maintenance plans for CHO, ABJ, and LTO assets to ensure reliability, cost efficiency, and alignment with operational objectives.
	The role ensures maintenance activities are effectively scheduled, resourced, and integrated with production and turnaround plans in compliance with company and industry standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and maintain mid- and long-term maintenance and asset integrity plans across CHO, ABJ, and LTO sites.
	Coordinate with operations, maintenance, and engineering teams to define work scopes and schedules.
	Analyze equipment history, performance data, and reliability trends to optimize maintenance strategies.
	Prepare detailed maintenance forecasts, manpower requirements, and material planning.
	Integrate maintenance plans with production, shutdown, and project schedules to minimize downtime.
	Track progress of planned activities and ensure timely execution in line with performance targets.
	Ensure maintenance plans comply with HSE and quality management systems.
	Generate periodic reports on maintenance performance, cost analysis, and asset reliability.


Qualifications and Experience


	B.Sc. or HND in Mechanical, Electrical, or Industrial Engineering (or related field).
	5–8 years of experience in maintenance planning or reliability engineering within the oil and gas sector.
	Strong understanding of preventive and predictive maintenance principles.
	Proficiency in planning software and CMMS tools (e.g., SAP PM, Primavera, MS Project).
	Knowledge of reliability-centered maintenance (RCM) and asset lifecycle management.
	Experience coordinating multi-site or multi-asset maintenance operations is an advantage.


Skills and Competencies:


	Excellent planning, scheduling, and analytical skills.
	Strong communication and cross-functional coordination abilities.
	Good understanding of maintenance and reliability best practices.
	Detail-oriented with strong organizational and documentation skills.
	Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities.
	Commitment to safety, quality, and continuous improvement.
